page.title: 05The Forester's Talk:N.Silton
page.content: The whole area of the forest is 1200 acres.It is mainly of conifers because of the acid soil conditions.These are European Larch,Japanese Larch,Scots Pine,Sitka Spruce and Norway Spruce.Hardwoods planted are sycamore and beech. All the woods are open to the public on foot.There is a small car park for 20 cars,picnic tables and a wildlife trail.Wildlife is varied and includes pheasants,deer,rabbits,a few stoats and weasels,adders,slow worms,frogs,toads,foxes,beetles,worms and badgers.Birds include woodpigeons,finches(gold,green and bull),blackbirds,thrushes,kestrels, sparrow hawks,wrens and other small birds.Deer are controlled and are culled if they exceed one deer per 20 hectares.Rabbits and squirrels are regarded as pests also.
